It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like stems and tiny, bladder-like structures called vesicles, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. Its leaves are often reduced to small, scale-like structures, while the main photosynthetic function is carried out by the stems. Brachionidium capillare plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
